title: 605 West 111th Street #63
description:
Located in the vibrant Morningside Heights neighborhood, just a short walk from Columbia University, this beautiful, spacious 2-bedroom, 1-bathroom apartment is a true gem. Boasting a generous layout, the interior features open spaces with clean lines  that create an inviting atmosphere. Each room offers ample space for relaxation and creativity, while the modern kitchen and bathroom are designed for both functionality and comfort. The apartment is filled with natural light, enhancing its warm ambiance and  making it the perfect place for you to settle down and call home.
This charming residence at 605 West 11th Street is housed within a beautifully preserved co-op building, originally constructed in 1905 and showcasing the elegant Beaux-Arts architectural style. The Markenfield, as the building is known, rises gracefully over  six stories and is home to fifty-two units. Its rich history and meticulously maintained fa ade radiates a sense of timeless charm.
With the amenities, you'll find the convenience of a resident superintendent dedicated to ensuring the upkeep of the building. Additional amenities include a secure bike room for cycling enthusiasts and a well-equipped laundry room that adds to the apartment's  practicality. This apartment offers the perfect blend of historic elegance and modern convenience, making it an ideal place to create lasting memories.
About Morningside Heights: Its boundaries extend from Riverside Drive to Morningside Park and from 110th Street to 125th Street.
Once referred to as the Academic Acropolis of Manhattan due to its numerous scholarly institutions-Columbia University, Barnard College, the Manhattan School of Music, Teachers College, and the Cathedral of St. John the Divine, the world's largest Gothic church,  to name a few-Morningside Heights is also culturally rich in commerce. The area boasts many cafes, restaurants, entertainment venues, open-air markets, and specialty shops.
Convenient subway stations, such as the #1 at 110th and Broadway, the B and C lines at 110th and Central Park West, and the crosstown bus at 110th and Broadway, make this location ideal for reaching all areas of the city.
Please, no pets of any kind.
